com.google.capillary.android

Interface CapillaryHandler


  • public interface CapillaryHandler
    Defines the interface for generating Capillary public keys and decrypting Capillary ciphertexts.

    One should implement CapillaryHandler and pass an instance to:

    • DecrypterManager to decrypt Capillary ciphertexts.
    • KeyManager to generate Capillary public keys.

    The implemented CapillaryHandler should finish the execution of its methods as soon as possible. Any long-running tasks, such as network requests, should be done in separate threads.

      Signals that a Capillary ciphertext was saved to be decrypted after user authentication.

      Signals that an error has occurred.

      Provides the plaintext after decrypting a Capillary ciphertext.

    • Method Detail

      • handleData

        void handleData(boolean isAuthKey,
                byte[] data,
                java.lang.Object extra)
        Provides the plaintext after decrypting a Capillary ciphertext.
        Parameters:
        isAuthKey - whether the decryption was done using a public key requiring authentication.
        data - the plaintext.
        extra - the extra parameter originally passed to DecrypterManager.

      • handlePublicKey

        void handlePublicKey(boolean isAuthKey,
                     byte[] publicKey,
                     java.lang.Object extra)
        Provides the generated Capillary public key.
        Parameters:
        isAuthKey - whether the public key requires authentication.
        publicKey - the public key.
        extra - the extra parameter originally passed to KeyManager.

      • handlePublicKey

        void handlePublicKey(boolean isAuthKey,
                     byte[] publicKey,
                     byte[] ciphertext,
                     java.lang.Object extra)
        Provides the Capillary public key that was generated as a result of a decryption error.
        Parameters:
        isAuthKey - whether the public key requires authentication.
        publicKey - the public key.
        ciphertext - the ciphertext that caused the decryption error.
        extra - the extra parameter originally passed to DecrypterManager.

      • authCiphertextSavedForLater

        void authCiphertextSavedForLater(byte[] ciphertext,
                                 java.lang.Object extra)
        Signals that a Capillary ciphertext was saved to be decrypted after user authentication.
        Parameters:
        ciphertext - the saved Capillary ciphertext.
        extra - the extra parameter originally passed to DecrypterManager.

      • error

        void error(CapillaryHandlerErrorCode errorCode,
           byte[] ciphertext,
           java.lang.Object extra)
        Signals that an error has occurred.
        Parameters:
        errorCode - the error code enum.
        ciphertext - the Capillary ciphertext that is affected by this error.
        extra - the extra parameter originally passed to DecrypterManager.
